cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi east of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend, then accelerate northeastward up the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of the Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River, FL Keys Craig Key westward, and portions of central/western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Big Bend, coastal Georgia, the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic coast including New Jersey, and New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25–35 mph Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in Delaware River/upper Delaware Bay; minor tidal departures possible (<3 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday with pockets of higher amounts, leading to localized ponding and brief river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat and short-fuse marine squalls possible as the storm’s remnant center crosses nearby
